channel.title: My pickup command has does not work :(
channel.description:
Okay, for my server i use hiyascape v1. Everytime i try the ::pickup command i get a mesage saying "c'mon type IT AGAIN!" and i have tried recoding it from a source that ::pickup does work in. I just get errors while compiling and i was wondering does anybody know why? it is 317 and not delta :)
Example: [code]::pickup 0995 25000000[/code]
When i hit enter/return i get this [code]c'mon type IT AGAIN![/code]
Please help ;)

item.title: My pickup command has does not work :(
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Anybody who uses that dumb pickup command which relies on substrings fails. Use the String class’ split() method, split by spaces.

[quote=“lolipownu, post:8, topic:273786”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=361809.msg2751960#msg2751960 date=1239969445]

[quote author=lolipownu link=topic=361809.msg2751957#msg2751957 date=1239968870]
Thanks guys, but how come on other servers for the gold code it is 0995 not 00995?
Thanks
[/quote][/quote][/quote]

What a worthless comment. If all you’re going to do is quote somebody else in a post, don’t post at all. Kthx

Read full topic
item.source: My pickup command has does not work :(

item.title: My pickup command has does not work :(
item.dc:creator: @lolipownu lolipownu
item.description:
@lolipownu wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:7, topic:273786”][quote author=lolipownu link=topic=361809.msg2751957#msg2751957 date=1239968870]
Thanks guys, but how come on other servers for the gold code it is 0995 not 00995?
Thanks
[/quote]

Thanks

The zeros are there as place holders. They have no contribution to the ID. Both 0995 and 00995 actualy mean item ID 995. The zeros are there to allow java to read the numbers correctly.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: My pickup command has does not work :(

item.title: My pickup command has does not work :(
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“lolipownu, post:6, topic:273786”]Thanks guys, but how come on other servers for the gold code it is 0995 not 00995?
Thanks :D[/quote]

The zeros are there as place holders. They have no contribution to the ID. Both 0995 and 00995 actualy mean item ID 995. The zeros are there to allow java to read the numbers correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: My pickup command has does not work :(
item.dc:creator: @lewiskitapci lewiskitapci
item.description:
@lewiskitapci wrote:

[quote=“9d n 1 n e, post:4, topic:273786”]if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }[/quote]

thats not what they are looking for, they want to know why pickup doesn’t work and it because they didn’t put 5 digits

Read full topic
item.source: My pickup command has does not work :(

item.title: My pickup command has does not work :(
item.dc:creator: @9d_n_1_n_e 9d n 1 n e
item.description:
@9d_n_1_n_e wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @lewiskitapci lewiskitapci
item.description:
@lewiskitapci wrote:

yeah, you need 5 digits for it to work so it would be

::pickup (Item ID) (Amount)
